meanings.definition: The state or quality of being buggy.
meanings.sent1: The bugginesses of the old computer made it slow and unreliable.
meanings.sent2: The programmer fixed the bugginesses in the code to improve performance.
meanings.sent3: Despite its bugginesses, the video game was still enjoyable to play.
meanings.sent4: The bugginesses of the software were like hidden traps waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The bugginesses of the system were causing frustration among the users.

meanings.definition: The presence of bugs or glitches in a system or software.
meanings.sent1: Users reported the bugginesses of the app after encountering multiple errors.
meanings.sent2: The IT team worked tirelessly to eliminate the bugginesses in the network.
meanings.sent3: The bugginesses in the program turned a simple task into a frustrating ordeal.
meanings.sent4: The bugginesses of the website were like little gremlins causing mischief.
meanings.sent5: The bugginesses of the software were hindering productivity in the office.

meanings.definition: The tendency to have defects or faults.
meanings.sent1: The bugginesses of the car became apparent after multiple breakdowns.
meanings.sent2: The new update aimed to reduce the bugginesses in the system.
meanings.sent3: His bugginesses for forgetting things often led to amusing situations.
meanings.sent4: The bugginesses of the plan were exposed when things started to go wrong.
meanings.sent5: The bugginesses of the product were a constant source of frustration for customers.
